results.title: The End of summer
results.brief_description: Filmed at a summer cottage in the Laurentians north of Montreal, this film penetrates briefly the charmed world of the adolescent. Watching and listening, you sense the bittersweet mood of childhood’s end, the poignant awareness that nothing will ever be the same after this summer at the lake. With English subtitles. (Award: New York)

results.title: The End of St Petersburg = Konyets Sankt-Peterburga [DVD]
results.brief_description: Originally made to commemorate the tenth year of the overthrow of Czarist Russia, Pudovkin’s film tells the story of a peasant boy who comes to St. Petersburg in search of work and witnesses the October Revolution. Set against the background of the historical events which culminated in the attack on the Winter Palace, the film contains graphic anti-war statements and was so realistically shot, that some interpreted the footage as documentary evidence of real events. Despite numerous crowd scenes, Pudovkin focuses on the struggle of the individual to relay the concerns of a people. Contains striking black and white cinematography, and expressionistic performances from Alexander Chistyakov and Vera Baranovska. Based on the poem, “The Bronze horseman” by Pushkin and the novel “St Petersburg” by Andrev Biely.

results.title: The End of one
results.brief_description: A wordless parable of modern society in which masses of seagulls fighting for growing mounds of garbage are intercut with the final feeble movements of a single dying bird while tractors and jet planes roar in the distance

results.title: The Encircling sea
results.brief_description: No part of New Zealand is very far from the sea and as a result it has become part of the lives of the inhabitants. Many are engaged in the fishing industry; boating and sailing are popular pastimes; and the numerous beaches within easy reach of the city dweller, provide opportunities for swimming and relaxation.

results.title: The Enchanted miller
results.creator_credit: Czechoslovak State Film, Official Films and Josef Vacha
results.brief_description: A cartoon version of a folk tale. A water demon has enchanted a mill and put its workers to flight. He torments them and continually evades their clutches by changing his shape. Finally they catch him and cut off his coat tails, thus depriving him of his magic powers.

results.title: The Enchanted Cottage
results.creator_credit: Harriet Parsons, RKO Radio Pictures and John Cromwell
results.brief_description: A disfigured World War II veteran marries a decidedly plain girl and they seclude themselves inside a small New England cottage. A small miracle occurs when they are transformed into a handsome couple, as they see each other through the eyes of love. Based on the play by Sir Arthur Wing Pinero, this fable proves that beauty is in the eye of the beholder. Starring Dorothy McGuire and Robert Young.

results.title: The Emu and the sun
results.brief_description: An animated film based on an Aboriginal legend about how emus became wingless birds and how sunlight came to earth.

results.title: The Empty seas
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures and Henri Fabiani
results.brief_description: Camaret, on the coast of Brittany, relies on lobster fishing and boat building for its livelihood. However, some areas are being fished out and the industry is dying. Shows the continued, and often unrewarded, toil of the men on one of the lobster boats, whose search extends as far as South America and Mauritania.

results.title: The Empty quarter
results.creator_credit: Mostafa Hammuri, I T T Productions and Richard Taylor
results.brief_description: Traces the expedition of the Englishman, Wilfred Patrick Thesiger, through the desert of South Arabia, the home of the Bedouin. Provides an intimate insight into the life and customs of the inhabitants of the ‘Empty Quarter’ of Arabia

results.title: The Empty pillow = Al-Wisada al-khalia = Illussions d'amour
results.creator_credit: Ramsis Naguib, Le Societe Arabe pour le Cinema, Arabic Cinema and Salah Abou Seif
results.brief_description: Romantic drama starring Abdel Halim Hafez as the young student Salah who falls in love with the innocent Samiha played by Lubna Abdel Aziz. However Samiha’s parents have other ideas - they want Samiha to marry the wealthy Dr Fouad. Desperate, Salah decides to take matters into his own hands with unexpected consequences. Photography by Mahmoud Nasr.
